intro: Uropetalon concanense, commonly known as the Indian broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae, characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is native to the Indian subcontinent and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Uropetalon concanense is often found in open woodlands and along forest edges, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
